âœ… Approved the contribution.
Comment: pretty easy but nice for shortest and reverse format

This is a fun little thing. I think I've found one of the shortest solutions in python (39 characters), and it's a shame it just uses builtins.

Goal section:
* Maybe it's better if you only use the first and last sentences in the goal section. With how short this text is, it's unnecessary and a bit confusing if you add big warning signs saying this one sentence may not be useful to read. Why don't you let people figure that out for themselves? It's only one sentence. People can already figure out halfway through the sentence that "ah, this is about the definition of a hexadecimal number, I can skip this" and go look at the following text or start programming.

Tests:
* The 4th validator has only zeroes. I'd consider this a special case, so I'd like to see it as a test case instead of a validator. For the validator of that test case, you can then put a string of zeroes of a different length. As a separate test and validator pair, you can then have the test case with lots of (but not all) zeroes.

Goal section
* The first sentence doesn't seem to add much of an interesting background? Maybe just delete it?

* Why the warning?

* Please fix the typo: "it's digits" => "its digits".

* Please fix the typo: "Were" => "where" (lowercase "w" and delete the full-stop before the word).

Constraints section
* Please delete the constraint. Any output is bound to be smaller than or equal to the input, so it is more meaningful to include the range of [[h]] as a constraint.

Thanks.

Nice puzzle. My best solution: 40 characters (in py3)
Only one question: Why is limit 10^6 when max output is 10^2?

I just fixed it thanks to your and 5DN1L's feedback 
thank you for helping me become a better codingamer :D

Thank you for your feedback!
Oh and btw 5DN1L are you an admin? since you have almost every certification.
Thank you for helping me become a better codingamer :D

Thank you for your feedback,
I have implemented your changes.

Hello, could you explain to me what you mean by "trop difficile"? Because I would like to know if there is anything I can do to make this contribution better.
Have a fantastic day :)
C'est trop difficile car certaines personnes ne peuvent pas le faire car il n'ont pas encore le niveau, comme moi

I see, but that is a general problem with the website for example: there are many different puzzles about the ASCII table even though I have idea what it even is. If I where to reject puzzles because of that then there would barely be any puzzles left.
Thank you for your feedback and have a great day :)
My new best is 40. Where did you lose one character?

Thanks Lumenit.

Redrat, maybe it's best if we move this discussion to another platform to avoid spoiling it for other people? (you got discord? I have the same name there)
That being said, I rewrote my solution, and now it's apparently 37 characters? No idea why it jumped to 39 characters when I last did it. Maybe I'm going blind. I'm using the sum builtin with a generator expression and `int(i,16)` to convert one hex character to an int. Remove unnecessary spaces, and voila. :) Maybe I should add that you don't need spaces between brackets and keywords/variables.

No problem, glad to help! ðŸ˜ƒ

You missed one comment ðŸ˜‰
* Please fix the typo: "Were" => "where" (lowercase "w" and delete the full-stop before the word).

Only CG staff can be admin. I'm a moderator:
https://www.codingame.com/playgrounds/40701/help-center/moderation

Ah ok I was wondering if you are a mod/admin or just someone who cheated/played a lot on the website.
Thanks again for your feedback :D
